news.title: Godrej Properties acquires 8.5-acre land parcel in Mahalunge, Pune
news.para: Godrej Properties has acquired an 8.5-acre site in Mahalunge, Pune, where they have plans to build a residential community. This project is projected to rake in around ₹2,000 crore.

news.title: Ghaziabad: GDA set to hand over five colonies, pay ₹66 crore for pending civic work to GMC
news.para: Ghaziabad Development Authority (GDA) and Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation (GMC) have formalized the handover of five colonies, with GDA allocating Rs 66 crore for infrastructure upgrades. This marks the first seamless handover agreement since Indirapuram, addressing long-pending development works in areas like Swarn Jyantipuram and Pratap Vihar.

news.title: From Feb 1, property registration in Uttar Pradesh through Aadhaar-based authentication
news.para: Uttar Pradesh's state cabinet has approved an Aadhaar-based authentication system for property registrations, set to be implemented from February 1. This move aims to curb land scams by verifying identities electronically through e-KYC, biometrics, and e-signatures. Additionally, a project to digitize old property documents from 2002-2017 has been extended by six months.

news.title: Chhattisgarh’s Dhamtari becomes first district in country to collect property tax via SAMARTH portal
news.para: Dhamtari district has become the first in India to launch online tax collection for its gram panchayats via the SAMARTH Panchayat portal. This digital initiative, successfully piloted in Sankara gram panchayat, allows rural residents to pay property taxes from home using UPI, aiming to simplify administration and boost self-reliance.

news.title: Over 6,000 affordable homes in Gurugram, 4,728 applicants shortlisted in first phase, verification on
news.para: Gurugram has received over 1.2 lakh applications for 6,743 affordable EWS houses priced at Rs 1.5 lakh each. The booking process is underway for 1-BHK flats, with a transparent verification and draw system in place. Eligible applicants are urged to deposit the booking amount promptly to secure housing benefits.

news.title: Apple expands Hyderabad office footprint to 6.3 lakh sq ft at Xander’s WaveRock Campus
news.para: Apple India has expanded its presence at Hyderabad's WaveRock IT campus, leasing an additional 65,168 square feet. This brings the tech giant's total footprint at the Xander-owned property to nearly 6.3 lakh square feet, solidifying its position as a major tenant. The new lease, for a five-year term, underscores Hyderabad's growing importance as a hub for global capability centers.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh draws up note on metropolitan corporation for Noida after SC order
news.para: The UP industries department has prepared a note for the state council of ministers on creating a metropolitan corporation in Noida, a move requiring legislative changes. This proposal stems from a Supreme Court order following a Special Investigation Team's report that criticized Noida Authority's functioning and recommended a more transparent, citizen-centric governance model.

news.title: SC stays Orissa high court order on legality of CC issued to Pahala project
news.para: The Supreme Court has stayed an Orissa High Court ruling that excluded a major real estate project from RERA. The High Court had deemed the project completed in 2015, prior to RERA's implementation. However, the apex court's intervention revives uncertainty, questioning if completion certificates alone suffice without occupancy and safety clearances.

news.title: Haryana revenue department seeks pending PAN details in high-value property registrations
news.para: In a bid to streamline property transactions, Haryana officials are urging all individuals engaged in deals exceeding 30 lakh rupees to promptly provide their Permanent Account Number (PAN) details. This directive targets deals spanning from the fiscal years 2019-20 through 2024-25.

news.title: Orient Cement's profit up over two-fold at ₹27.8 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Orient Cement Ltd, an Adani group firm, announced a significant profit jump in the third quarter. Profit after tax surged to Rs 27.8 crore, more than double the Rs 10.14 crore recorded last year. Revenue from operations saw a slight dip to Rs 636.1 crore from Rs 643.35 crore.

news.title: EESL to deploy energy-efficient solutions to PMAY beneficiaries in Andhra Pradesh
news.para: Energy Efficiency Services Limited (EESL) is collaborating with the Andhra Pradesh State Housing Corporation Limited (APSHCL) to enhance living conditions for beneficiaries of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana. Households will be equipped with a starter kit featuring LED bulbs, LED batten tube lights, and BLDC ceiling fans.

news.title: Prestige Estates Projects posts profit of ₹244.7 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Prestige Estates Projects saw a substantial profit jump to ₹244.7 crore in Q3 FY26. Total income surged by 128.84 percent to ₹3,885.5 crore. Sales and collections also showed strong year-on-year growth. The company added new land parcels and increased its stake in a key project.

news.title: UK's Crest Nicholson sees signs of housing market recovery
news.para: Crest Nicholson, a British developer, is witnessing promising signs of recovery in the housing market. The recent government budget seems to have sparked an uptick in demand, leading to increased website traffic and a surge in sales inquiries. With more favorable interest rates, January's sales figures are showing resilience.

news.title: Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley together buy 4.9% stake in Sunteck Realty for ₹268 crore
news.para: Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley have acquired a significant stake in Sunteck Realty. They collectively bought 4.9 percent of the real estate firm for Rs 268 crore. This transaction occurred through open market deals.

news.title: India’s REIT-ready office stock crosses 415 million sq ft: Economic Survey
news.para: India's commercial real estate is seeing deeper institutionalisation. Over 415 million sq ft of office space is REIT-eligible. Small and medium REITs are emerging as a new investment avenue. REITs continue to operate under a tax pass-through framework.

news.title: Outstanding individual home loans jump nearly four times to ₹37 lakh crore at March-end 2025: Survey
news.para: Outstanding individual housing loans have surged to over Rs 37 lakh crore by March 2025. This represents a rise in home loans as a percentage of GDP to over 11 percent. Government policies and initiatives have supported this expansion. Housing sales have also increased post-pandemic.

news.title: Treating wastewater can unlock market worth ₹3.2 lakh crore by 2047: Economic Survey
news.para: India's urban growth faces a new economic opportunity: the circular water economy. The Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights treating wastewater as a resource. This shift could create a market worth lakhs of crore by 2047. It also promises over one lakh jobs. Reusing treated water will secure freshwater for essential needs and drive urban development.

news.title: Economic survey calls for "holistic rethink" of development control regulations
news.para: As India's urban centers navigate a pivotal moment, the Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights the urgent need for a transformative shift in city management. A newly proposed fund promises to invigorate competition in urban funding, prompting cities to embrace market-oriented financial strategies.

news.title: Supply of affordable housing plummets to just 17% in 2025: Economic Survey
news.para: In India's bustling urban centers, affordable housing is becoming increasingly elusive. Properties priced below ₹50 lakh are dwindling, putting immense pressure on low-income families who struggle to find a roof over their heads. While developers are shifting their focus to the outskirts of cities, these new developments often fall short on essential amenities and transport links.

news.title: Centre notifies solid waste management rules; applicable from April 1
news.para: On April 1, new regulations for Solid Waste Management will kick in, requiring everyone to adopt a four-stream waste segregation system from the outset. For those generating substantial waste, clear-cut responsibilities for waste management have been established.
